resources.string: All it takes is steady practice.
You can live in paradise. All it takes is steady practice.

string-array.name: section_1_para_1
string-array.item: Copyright 2017 © Roach City Software.
This software is licensed under the Eclipse Public License 1.0.
Source code is available on GitHub. The project name is \"Golden Key\".

string-array.name: section_2_para_1
string-array.item: This software is designed to change brain function.
Specifically, it is designed to increase the over-all
activity level of the reward centers.

string-array.name: section_2_para_2
string-array.item: The reward centers become more active when good things happen,
and we feel happy. However, the reward centers don\'t stay
active very long, and the happy feeling generally doesn\'t
last. Most of us try to become happy by making more good
things happen - a never-ending struggle. There is an
alternative (or perhaps complimentary) approach.

string-array.name: section_2_para_3
string-array.item: Researchers studying happiness have noted that some people are generally happier
than others - and that it doesn\'t seem to have much to do with what\'s actually
happening in their lives. People just seem to have different basic happiness levels.
This means that the reward centers have different base-line levels of activity in
different people. When nothing particularly good or bad is happening, some people
feel good - have active reward centers - and some people don\'t.

string-array.name: section_2_para_4
string-array.item: Knowing that some people are just basically happier than others wouldn\'t help much
if you couldn\'t do anything about it - but you can. The reward centers are highly
plastic - their basic activity level changes easily, and a lot, in response to
stimulus patterns. This is proven by the phenomenon of drug addiction. The reward centers
adapt to the stimulation from the drug, and become less active without the drug. This means
that addicts feel bad all the time when they aren\'t high.

string-array.name: section_2_para_5
string-array.item: Golden Key is designed to produce the opposite effect of drug addiction. Whether
stimulation produces habituation (decreased activity, as in drug addiction) or
potentiation (increased activity) depends on the timing and intensity of the
stimulus. Golden Key uses happy thoughts to stimulate the reward centers
continuously, and as intensely as you can manage, for a limited interval
(fifteen minutes). After that, the reward centers are allowed to recover. This
pattern will build up the reward centers, not wear them out.

string-array.name: section_2_para_6
string-array.item: To get the most good out of Golden Key, it\'s important to practice correctly. Continue
practicing for the full fifteen minutes - until the \"Next\" button says \"Done\". Practice
once a day, every day. Hold each happy thought just long enough to feel really happy, then
move to the next thought. Don\'t let the happy feeling start to fade - you\'re not trying to
desensitize yourself to happy thoughts! Make sure your list of good things to think about
incudes lots of different kinds of happy thoughts - you\'re trying to build happiness in general,
not just greater liking for one or two kinds of things.

string-array.name: section_3_para_1
string-array.item: Golden Key stores a lot of data. The most important data is your list of things that make you
happy. Golden Key also stores data on your use of the app - needed for reminders and feedback
messages. After you put in the work to build a long list of things you like, you won\'t want
to lose this data. It\'s also personal enough so that you probably want to keep it private.

string-array.name: section_3_para_2
string-array.item: Golden Key relies on Android for both data security and data backup. Android maintains
the data for Golden Key in a private database file that is only accessible to the Golden
Key app. To keep other people from running Golden Key and seeing your list that way, you will
need to password-protect your device. To have Android back up your data to your Goggle Drive,
make sure \"Back up my data\" is enabled under the \"Backup & reset\" option in Settings.
More flexible backup options are available through third-party apps.

resources.string: Build a list of good things first - then practice.
Tap item to edit (or delete) if needed.

string-array.name: praise_list
string-array.item: Way to go!
Excellent!
Very good!
Congratulations!
Good job!

resources.string: Maximum items added in one session:
This world can be both heaven and hell. It\'s hell when your mind is filled with bad things - problems, failures, loss and pain. It\'s heaven when your mind is filled with good things.

You can train your mind to focus more on the good things. Practice thinking about good things, and feeling happy about them. This app helps you train. Start by building a list of good things – at least 50 items (to start with). Use that list to practice felling happy about good things – in 15 minute sessions once a day. As with any kind of training, steady practice is key.

After a week of regular, daily practice, you will sometimes feel really good for no particular reason. Keep on training, and this will happen more and more. After a month of steady practice, you will feel very happy most of the time. Steady practice is the golden key to paradise.
